pageContext.description: A heavily corroded copper alloy fragment of a Bronze Age axe measuring 51.6mm by 30.9mm. The fragment is pelta-shaped and comprises the blade tip. The area behind the blade is fluted with three pronounced ribs perpendicular to the blade edge and has a rectangular cross section. The remaining surface has a dark green patina. Probably from a palstave of Middle Bronze Age dating (c. 1500 BC to c. 1150 BC). For a more complete example see WMID-7D44CA.
pageContext.notes: Found in the same area as SUR-E72368, but no clear association is demonstrable due to a lack of accurate findspot being provided by the finder.
